question_text:
What is the surface area of this cylinder?
Use ‚Äãùúã = 3.14 and round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
 _
backend_description: Shows a cylinder with radius 7 cm and height 6 cm. The cylinder is shown in 3D perspective with the circular top and bottom visible. Students calculate surface area using these dimensions.
solution_image_tag: Labels the cylinder dimensions clearly: radius = 7 cm, height = 6 cm. These measurements are needed for the surface area calculation.

Shows the rectangular shape that represents the curved surface when 'unrolled.' The rectangle has height 6 cm and width equal to the circumference (43.96 cm). The area calculation shows: A_side = C x h = 43.96 x 6 = 263.76 square cm.
solution: Find the radius and height of the cylinder.
Find the area of the circle on the top of the cylinder. Use 3.14 for ‚Äãùúã.
The circle on the bottom of the cylinder is the same.
Find the circumference of the top circle.
Now find the area of the curved surface. The curved surface is a rectangle. One side length is the height, and the other side length is the circumference of the circle.
Now add the areas to find the surface area of the cylinder. Surface area = A_top + A_bottom + A_side.
The surface area of the cylinder is about 571.48 square centimetres.

question_text:

 _
backend_description: Shows a cylinder with radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. The cylinder is shown in 3D perspective with the circular top and bottom visible. Students calculate surface area using these dimensions.
solution_image_tag: Shows the rectangular shape that represents the curved surface when 'unrolled.' The rectangle has height 12 cm and width equal to the circumference (31.4 cm).
solution:
Find the radius and height of the cylinder.
r = 5 cm, h = 12 cm
Find the area of the circle on the top of the cylinder. Use 3.14 for ùúã.
The circle on the bottom of the cylinder is the same.
Find the circumference of the top circle.

Now find the area of the curved surface. The curved surface is a rectangle. One side length is the height, and the other side length is the circumference of the circle.
Area = C x h = 31.4 x 12 = 376.8 square cm.
Now add the areas to find the surface area of the cylinder. Surface area = A_top + A_bottom + A_side.
The surface area of the cylinder is about 533.8 square centimetres.

solution_image_tag: Shows the rectangular shape that represents the curved surface when 'unrolled.' The rectangle has height 13 cm and width equal to the circumference (18.84 cm).
solution:
Find the radius and height of the cylinder.
r = 3 cm, h = 13 cm
Find the area of the circle on the top of the cylinder. Use 3.14 for ùúã.
The circle on the bottom of the cylinder is the same.
Find the circumference of the top circle.

Now find the area of the curved surface. The curved surface is a rectangle. One side length is the height, and the other side length is the circumference of the circle.
Area = C x h = 18.84 x 13 = 244.92 square cm.
Now add the areas to find the surface area of the cylinder. Surface area = A_top + A_bottom + A_side.
The surface area of the cylinder is about 301.44 square centimetres.
